element.name: Liffey Bridges-Lucan by Kili or bust, Traditional Cache (1/1)

center.font: Visit The Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

br.br:
Lucan Bridge is a road bridge spanning the River Liffey in the village of Lucan in County Dublin.. It joins Lucan's Main Street to the Lower Lucan Road, carrying traffic towards Clonsilla and the north.
The bridge is the largest single span masonry arch bridge in Ireland, and is constructed from ashlar masonry with a span of 110 feet (33 meters) and a rise of 22 feet (6.7 meters). It is framed by iron balustraded parapets made by the Royal Phoenix ironworks of Parkgate Street in Dublin.
Architected by George Knowles (architect of Dublin's Fr. Mathew and O'Donovan Rossa Bridges), it was built in 1814 in collaboration with James Savage to replace several previous bridges which were carried away by floods.
The first bridge built on this spot was a stone bridge laid down in the later years of the reign of King John (c.1200). A subsequent bridge was built by the first Agmondisham Vesey c.1730, but washed away within very short time. The next was built c.1771, but this too washed away in a flood in 1786 - as did it's replacement.
In 1814, the present single span bridge was completed by Savage & Knowles, and has remained largely unaffected by the effects of flooding common to this stretch of the Liffey. The bridge however has seen some recent developments, with the raising of the roadway near both ends of the arch to lessen the gradient for road traffic.
It is not uncommon to see anglers carrying big salmon from the river below. On bright summer days local children use the weir area below for picnicking, swimming and boating.

element.encoded-hints: Go West my son, by Zepplin!

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Mullingar Man
clue made no sense to me, hope to return soon!

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by anxie
Nice bridge, have crossed it many times without realising how impressive it is. the GPS was going bonkers, so ended up under the bridge, which was interesting :-) Anyhow, I found the spot, but not the cache, was under pressure to get going, so will have to come back again. thanks for the cache.

2010-05-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by Drea-Popa
After a long drive it was a great pleasure to walk to this nice river and log a cache. Thanks for this one.

2010-05-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by CH-vishnu
As we stayed in a nearby B&B, we found this cache on a nice walk to the river. Thanks for the cache! Greetings from Switzerland.

2010-05-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by st5346
After searching around a while in the wrong place I finally saw him :) THX for hiding and greetings from Germany!

2009-07-19T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Kersti.com
No luck finding this one today
